Base.Explanation: Get information from a file or directory. The information includes the existence of the file or directory, type information (file or directory), attributes, creation, access times and size.

ArrayElement.Name: Target file/directory
ArrayElement.Description: The name of target file or directory. Can be specified using the full UNC path (recommended) or local path (local to the UMRA Service or Console application). Example: \\SERVER_A\Share_b\Directory_1\File.ext, \\SERVER_A\Share_b\Directory_1\Dir2, G:\UserData\John.

ArrayElement.Name: File/dir exists flag
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to 'Yes' if the file or directory exists.

ArrayElement.Name: Is directory flag
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to 'Yes' if the target path identifies a directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Attributes
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set equal to the attribute mask of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Creation time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the creation time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Last access time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the last access time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Last write time
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to the last write time of the file or directory.

ArrayElement.Name: Size
ArrayElement.Description: Output only property. When specified, the output variable value is set to size of the file in bytes (meaningless value for directories: 0).

ArrayElement.Name: Error if not found
ArrayElement.Description: Set to 'Yes' if this action should produce an error in case the file or directory does not exist. Default value: 'No'.

Base.Explanation: Delete the directory tree, including all files and subdirectories. Optionally, you can delete the specified directory itself. The directory tree is specified by a single directory name. The name must have the syntax: \\COMPUTER\Share\Directory_To_Delete or DRIVE:\Directory\Directory_To_Delete (local drive).

ArrayElement.Name: Directory name
ArrayElement.Description: The name of the directory tree to delete. All files, directories and subdirectories will be deleted from the specified directory. Optionally, you can delete the specified directory itself. The directory name must have the syntax: \\COMPUTER\Share\Directory_To_Delete or DRIVE:\Directory\Directory_To_Delete.

ArrayElement.Name: Delete directory option
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating if the specified directory itself (property: 'Directory name') must be deleted.

ArrayElement.Name: Delete read-only files and directories
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating if read-only files and directories must be removed as well. Default value: TRUE. To delete the read-only files and attributes, the read-only attribute is reset first.

ArrayElement.Name: Always use administrative share
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that the administrative share must be used to delete the directory. The administrative share is by default only used if the specified directory must be deleted and the directory corresponds with a share (Syntax: \\COMPUTER\Shared_Dir_To_Delete).

ArrayElement.Name: Never use administrative share
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that the administrative share should not be used to delete the directory. The administrative share is by default only used if the specified directory must be deleted and the directory corresponds with a share (Syntax: \\COMPUTER\Shared_Dir_To_Delete).

ArrayElement.Name: Use backup and restore privileges
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that backup and restore privileges must be used to delete the directory. This property is required in case the logged on user has no access rights to the directories and files that must be deleted. The logged on user must have the corresponding access rights configured on the target computer to use these privileges successfully. See the online help for more information.

ArrayElement.Name: Ignore error
ArrayElement.Description: A flag indicating that errors must be ignored. An error is for instance generated when the target directory does not exist.
